value.title: Use DAX time intelligence functions in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you’ll learn the meaning of time intelligence and how to add time intelligence DAX calculations to your model. These calculations will include year-to-date (YTD), year-over-year (YoY) growth, and others.

value.title: Discover customer needs as a Solution Architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
value.excerpt: Learn how to ask customers questions about their business processes and feature requirements to create a viable solution.

value.title: Power Platform - Introduction, business value, and demos
value.excerpt: Explore the capabilities of Power Platform applications, as seen in demonstrations and customer case studies.

value.title: Propose a solution as a Solution Architect for Power Platform and Dynamics 365
value.excerpt: Learn how to propose a solution.

value.title: Work with requirements as a solution architect for Power Platform and Dynamics 365
value.excerpt: It is important to capture the customer’s needs accurately. This module explains how to capture requirements and identify functional and non-functional items.

value.title: Drive organizational change with Microsoft Workplace Analytics and MyAnalytics
value.excerpt: After using Microsoft Workplace Analytics and Power BI to generate insights about your employees’ work behaviors, you’ll learn about the Microsoft 365 features that can be tools to implement and measure the changes you’ve identified. You’ll learn how to initiate common change practices and what tools and tactics are the most useful.

value.title: Analyze collaboration and engagement using the Workplace Analytics Ways of working assessment dashboard
value.excerpt: Learn to evaluate collaboration culture and employee experience with a Power BI template using Workplace Analytics data.

value.title: Calculate Totals for  MTD, QTD and YTD in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn how to quickly use the CALCULATE function to get total from year to date, month to date and quarter to date in Power BI using a Calendar table and time intelligence functions in DAX.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/qiLjmKoP9ag" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Dynamic Outlier Detection and Visualization with DAX in Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn the theory and best methods to create a dynamic sensitive outlier detectionand customize it to your particular dataset.

value.excerpt: This is one of the most import function to master in Power BI. You can filter your data and create complex measure such as year over year comparisons with ease with these easy to follow tutorial. More more help this function.

value.title: Create a bump or slope chart in Power BI
value.excerpt: Bump or slope charts are useful to sport changes between categories. There is no native bump or slope visual in Power BI, but you can create your own easily from a line chart. In this video I show you how. #curbal #power bi #bumpcharts  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center
